children.subject:
<md>Posting here since I don't really remember a whole lot. 
I took them both together. I don't believe it really helps a whole lot in terms of reducing the learning curve as they typically cover the same things at the same time. </md>

history.content: Hi, I am also a Bioengineering major who took Math 54 and EECS 16A for my Spring 2020 semester. In my experience, taking them together didn't really reduce the learning curve because they cover linear algebra topics at the same pace. What really helped though was the extra practice I got from each class, which helped out overall with the material in both classes. Math 54 also goes in more depth for some topics/proofs that EECS 16A brushes over, which is also beneficial since some 16A hws and exam problems ask you to go more in depth in lin alg concepts.

Hello!

Would taking Math 54 and EECS16a together help or make learning either more confusing (I'm interested in taking Math 54 at some point because the bioengineering major requires it). If I take both together, I would be taking 4 technical courses (with Math 53 and CS61b), but I'm wondering whether Math 54 and EECS16a would reduce the learning curve?
history.subject: Math 54 and EECS16a at the same time
